meanings.sent1: She felt very sad when she was wronged by her friend.
meanings.sent2: It is not right to treat someone in a wronged manner.
meanings.sent3: The puppy looked wronged when it didn't get a treat.
meanings.sent4: The wronged expression on her face showed her disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The wronged child's eyes filled with tears.

meanings.definition: To have done harm or injury to someone.
meanings.sent1: He wronged his brother by taking his toy without asking.
meanings.sent2: It is never okay to wrong someone intentionally.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat wronged the dog by stealing its bone.
meanings.sent4: The storm wronged the fragile flowers by blowing them away.
meanings.sent5: The careless driver wronged the pedestrian by not stopping at the crosswalk.
